Description:
Detects specific commands commonly used to remove or empty the syslog. Which is often used by attacker as a method to hide their tracks

Author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Commands to Clear or Remove the Syslog
Query: sourcetype like 'linux-%' eql select * from _source_ where (command like '%rm /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%rm -r /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%rm -f /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%rm -rf /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%unlink /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%unlink -r /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%unlink -f /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%unlink -rf /var/log/syslog%' or command like '%mv /var/log/syslog%' or command like '% >/var/log/syslog%' or command like '% > /var/log/syslog%')
